services.name: Essex Wellbeing Service
services.summary: The Essex Wellbeing Service (EWS) offers a comprehensive, free, and confidential support system for addiction and substance misuse, designed to help… Keywords: service, consumption improve, telephone virtual, southend, southend sea.
services.description: The Essex Wellbeing Service (EWS) offers a comprehensive, free, and confidential support system for addiction and substance misuse, designed to help residents (excluding Southend-on-Sea and Thurrock) reduce consumption and improve their overall health. The service is person-centred and provides, or links to, specialized support for both alcohol and drugs, tobacco/cigarrette smoking featuring 1:1, group, telephone, and virtual options

services.name: Frontline
services.summary: Free online list of services to tackle addiction including: drugs, alcohol, smoking, gambling, in various forms. Keywords: services tackle, alcohol smoking, smoking gambling, various forms, gambling.
services.description: Free online list of services to tackle addiction including: drugs, alcohol, smoking, gambling, in various forms.

services.name: Open Road
services.summary: The primary clinical hub for substance misuse in Harlow, operating from Unit 55 in The Harvey Centre. Keywords: medical, opiate, centre, treatment, prevent.
services.description:
The primary clinical hub for substance misuse in Harlow, operating from Unit 55 in The Harvey Centre.   

Access: The service prioritizes low-barrier access through drop-in assessment times (Mon-Thurs: 9:30am–12pm & 1pm–4pm), allowing individuals to seek help at the moment of motivation.   

Harm Reduction: The centre provides critical public health interventions, including a needle and syringe provision room to prevent blood-borne viruses, steroid packs, and Naloxone dispensing and training to prevent opiate overdose deaths.   

Treatment Pathways: For opiate users, Open Road works in partnership with Essex STaRS at the Princess Alexandra Hospital (Derwent Centre), ensuring medical oversight for substitution therapy.   

Holistic Support: Beyond medical treatment, the service offers one-to-one sessions, structured recovery programs, and the M-PACT program (Moving Parents and Children Together), which addresses the intergenerational impact of addiction

services.name: AL-Anon
services.summary: Support groups specifically for the families and friends of people with alcohol problems Keywords: alcohol problems, specifically families, friends people, people alcohol, families friends.
services.description: Support groups specifically for the families and friends of people with alcohol problems

services.name: Phoenix Futures
services.summary: This service operates at the intersection of criminal justice and health, supporting adults (18+) involved in the justice system who have substance use needs. Keywords: inclusion, social inclusion, justice, community, social.
services.description:
This service operates at the intersection of criminal justice and health, supporting adults (18+) involved in the justice system who have substance use needs.

Mechanism: It utilizes Conditional Cautions and Community Resolution appointments to divert individuals from custody into treatment.   

Social Inclusion: A key component is the "Social Inclusion" element, which is open to self-referral and focuses on connecting users with meaningful community activities to break the cycle of reoffending.

services.name: Essex Young People’s Drug and Alcohol Service (EYPDAS)
services.summary: Co-located with Open Road, EYPDAS offers age-appropriate interventions for those under 25. Keywords: interventions, group, service, educate young, week online.
services.description:
Co-located with Open Road, EYPDAS offers age-appropriate interventions for those under 25. This service acknowledges that youth addiction requires a different pedagogical and therapeutic approach.   

Interventions: Support includes one-to-one counseling, telephone support, and the "Recovery Pathway Group," a 6-week online course designed to educate young people on triggers and coping strategies.   

Education Link: The service delivers PSHE+ group work in schools, focusing on early intervention and the risks of emerging trends like illicit vaping.

services.name: Smart Recovery
services.summary: For those seeking a secular alternative to the 12-step model, Smart Recovery offers evidence-based tools (CBT, REBT) for managing addictive behaviors. Keywords: managing, recovery, online methodology, integrated broader, based tools.
services.description: For those seeking a secular alternative to the 12-step model, Smart Recovery offers evidence-based tools (CBT, REBT) for managing addictive behaviors. While meetings are often online, the methodology is integrated into the broader recovery discourse in the region. Building Motivation, Coping with Urges, Managing Thoughts/Feelings, and Living a Balanced Life

services.name: Action for Family Carers Essex
services.summary: The lead provider for West Essex (Harlow, Epping, Uttlesford). Keywords: day care, day, grants, 30, care.
services.description:
The lead provider for West Essex (Harlow, Epping, Uttlesford).

Counselling: They offer a free, confidential counseling service (up to 6 sessions) to help carers manage the emotional toll of their role.   

Grants: They facilitate "Time 4 You" grants, providing financial aid for carers to take a break or pursue a hobby.   

Support Groups: A Harlow support group meets at the Great Parndon Community Centre on the 2nd Tuesday of every month (10:30 am – 12:30 pm), providing peer connection.   

Day Care: They operate day care services that provide a safe environment for the cared-for person, granting the carer essential respite.

services.name: Carers First
services.summary: While Carers First is the lead for Mid/South Essex, they provide extensive online resources and the "Caring Confidently" training course, which helps carers… Keywords: carers, carers lead, knowledge accessible, knowledge, resources caring.
services.description: While Carers First is the lead for Mid/South Essex, they provide extensive online resources and the "Caring Confidently" training course, which helps carers build resilience and knowledge, accessible to all in the wider region.

services.summary: Local wellbeing groups, counselling, and grants for adult family carers Keywords: local wellbeing, counselling grants, grants adult, groups counselling, adult family.
services.description: Local wellbeing groups, counselling, and grants for adult family carers

services.name: Mobilise
services.summary: Recognizing that many carers cannot leave their homes, Mobilise offers a "digital-first" support system. Keywords: online, scheduled online, ensures support, mobility time, online chats.
services.description:
Recognizing that many carers cannot leave their homes, Mobilise offers a "digital-first" support system.

Offerings: An online hub with guides on benefits (e.g., Carer's Allowance), "cuppas" (scheduled online chats), and coaching calls. This model ensures support is accessible regardless of mobility or time constraints.

services.summary: offers a specialized respite model. Keywords: adults mental, community adults, house peace, dementia allows, model removing.
services.description: offers a specialized respite model. Rather than removing the cared-for person to a facility, they provide one-to-one support in the home or community for adults with mental health needs or dementia. This allows the carer to leave the house with peace of mind.

services.description: Directory of mental and emotional health services including all kinds of abuse support, children’s mental health, bereavement , support groups and activities.

services.name: Vita Minds West Essex
services.summary: Vita Health Group delivers the NHS Talking Therapies service (formerly IAPT) for West Essex. Keywords: service, digital, referral, 30 pm, pathways.
services.description:
Vita Health Group delivers the NHS Talking Therapies service (formerly IAPT) for West Essex. This service represents a significant shift towards patient autonomy through its "self-referral" model.

Eligibility: The service is open to anyone aged 16+ registered with a GP in Harlow, Uttlesford, or Epping Forest.   

Referral Pathways: The traditional barrier of requiring a GP referral has been removed. Patients can refer themselves via:

Telephone: A direct line (0333 015 2966) operates with extended hours (Mon–Thurs 8am–8pm, Fri 9am–5pm) to accommodate working adults.   

Digital Assistant: An automated tool named "Limbic" on their website guides users through a clinical assessment to streamline intake.   

Physical Drop-in: To bridge the digital divide, a drop-in service is hosted at Harlow Library on the last Tuesday of every month (12:30 pm – 2:30 pm). This ensures that those without digital access or confidence can still enter the therapeutic pathway.   

Interventions: The service offers a broad clinical menu, including Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), Interpersonal Therapy (IPT), Counselling for Depression, and specialized pathways for those whose mental health is impacted by long-term physical conditions.

services.name: Samaritans
services.summary: crisis listening services. Keywords: ware, branch, chelmsford, crisis, service.
services.description:
crisis listening services. While the national number (116 123) is available 24/7, local branches in Ware and Chelmsford provide regional coverage for Harlow.   

Modalities: Beyond the telephone, the Ware branch offers a chat service, aligning with the shift towards digital communication. The Chelmsford branch engages in active outreach, visiting schools and prisons to offer preventative emotional support, thereby extending the service's footprint beyond reactive crisis management.

services.name: Andy’s Man Club
services.summary: Addressing the critical issue of male suicide and the cultural stigma surrounding male mental health, Andy’s Man Club operates a strict but effective… Keywords: male, critical, group, free, obligation.
services.description:
Addressing the critical issue of male suicide and the cultural stigma surrounding male mental health, Andy’s Man Club operates a strict but effective peer-support model.

Operations: The group meets every Monday at 7:00 pm (excluding Bank Holidays) at the Latton Bush Centre.   

Protocol: The doors open at 18:45 to allow for settling in. The meetings are free, confidential, and require no booking or referral.   

Philosophy: The group is explicitly non-clinical and "judgement-free," designed to provide a space where men can discuss the "storms" in their lives without pressure. The "no obligation to speak" rule is a critical design feature, lowering the anxiety threshold for new attendees.

services.name: Shout
services.summary: Service Design: Users text "SHOUT" to 85258 to initiate a conversation. Keywords: service, round, text, text shout, texter.
services.description:
Service Design: Users text "SHOUT" to 85258 to initiate a conversation. The service operates 24/7, providing round-the-clock coverage.  
Therapeutic Model: The intervention is structured to move the texter from a "hot moment" of high distress to a "cool calm." Trained volunteers, supported by clinical supervisors, utilize active listening and planning techniques to help the user reach a safe state.

services.name: Hub of Hope
services.summary: he Hub of Hope is the UK's most comprehensive mental health support directory, managed by the charity Chasing the Stigma. Keywords: health support, services, uk, national, mental health.
services.description:
he Hub of Hope is the UK's most comprehensive mental health support directory, managed by the charity Chasing the Stigma.

Services: It provides a searchable database of thousands of mental health support services, including national organizations, local community groups, NHS services, and private or voluntary sector support.

How: Services are accessed through a web-based platform or mobile app using a postcode search or GPS geolocation. Users can filter results by specific needs or categories to find the most relevant local or national support.

Who it is for: It is designed for anyone in the UK seeking mental health support for themselves, as well as for friends, family members, or professionals looking to signpost others to appropriate care.

services.name: Employ-Ability
services.summary: Services: Specialist employment support, including job seeking assistance and job retention services for those at risk of losing employment due to mental… Keywords: employers, west, job, employment, mental.
services.description:
Services: Specialist employment support, including job seeking assistance and job retention services for those at risk of losing employment due to mental health challenges.

Delivery: Personalised mentoring and coaching using the Individual Placement and Support (IPS) model, alongside direct partnership and advocacy with employers.

Target Audience: Individuals experiencing mental ill health and local employers within South/West Essex and West Suffolk.

services.name: West Essex Night Owls
services.summary: Services: Emotional support for mental health difficulties (such as anxiety, depression, or loneliness) via telephone and face-to-face "Sanctuary Spaces."… Keywords: face, 30, 00, face sanctuary, sanctuary.
services.description:
Services: Emotional support for mental health difficulties (such as anxiety, depression, or loneliness) via telephone and face-to-face "Sanctuary Spaces."

How: Users must first register through an online form. A team member will call back within 24 hours to provide the dedicated support number. The phone line operates daily from 17:00–19:30 and 20:30–22:30, while face-to-face sanctuary support is available from 16:00–23:00.

Who: Adults (18+) residing in West Essex (Harlow, Epping Forest, and Uttlesford) who require non-crisis support

services.name: Butterfly Effect Wellbeing
services.summary: Located at "The Bungalow" in the Latton Bush Centre, this organization offers a holistic, activity-based approach to mental wellness. Keywords: 30pm, holistic, 11am, schedule, social.
services.description:
Located at "The Bungalow" in the Latton Bush Centre, this organization offers a holistic, activity-based approach to mental wellness. It operates daily, providing a schedule that integrates social support with therapeutic activities.   

Activity Schedule: The provision is diverse, including "Social Wellbeing Groups" (Mon/Wed/Fri 11am-2:30pm), "Mindful Gardening" (Tue 10am-12:30pm), and relaxation sessions for carers (Thu 11am-12pm).   

Holistic Therapies: In addition to social groups, they offer sound healing (Gong Baths) and Reiki, recognizing the somatic aspects of mental distress.   

Economic Accessibility: While some treatments have a charge, many activities are free or donation-based, ensuring the service remains accessible to low-income residents.

services.description: Interventions: The service offers a broad clinical menu, including Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), Interpersonal Therapy (IPT), Counselling for Depression, and specialized pathways for those whose mental health is impacted by long-term physical conditions.

services.description: Services: The platform offers access to advocacy, early intervention, employability coaching, and peer support groups, alongside therapeutic activities such as care farms and equine-assisted learning. Target Audience: Services are designed for children, young people, and adults with neurodivergent needs—including Autism and ADHD—as well as their parents and carers

services.name: Neurodiversity Network
services.summary: Neurodiversity Network is a digital resource hub that centralises information to support neurodivergent individuals in employment and education. Keywords: neurodivergent, job, services, provided, provided curated.
services.description:
Neurodiversity Network is a digital resource hub that centralises information to support neurodivergent individuals in employment and education.

* **Services:** It consolidates directories for neurodiverse-friendly job boards, career preparation tools, university initiatives, and advocacy resources.
* **How:** Services are provided through a curated online directory and informational platform.
* **Target Audience:** Neurodivergent job seekers and students, as well as employers and universities seeking to create inclusive environments.

services.name: Together For Neurodiversity
services.summary: This organization focuses on practical empowerment. Keywords: spectrum, neuro, neuro affirming, visual, visual aids.
services.description: This organization focuses on practical empowerment. They provide "Spectrum Support Packs" containing sensory tools (ear defenders, weighted pads) and visual aids (Now/Next boards), which are heavily subsidized or funded by grants. Their "Spectrum University" offers online training to help families and professionals understand neurodiversity through a neuro-affirming lens.

services.name: PACT
services.summary: Based in the Latton Bush Centre, PACT serves as a primary hub for the neurodiverse community. Keywords: parent, families, access, support, ensuring immediate.
services.description:
Based in the Latton Bush Centre, PACT serves as a primary hub for the neurodiverse community.

Open Access: They explicitly state that no formal diagnosis is required to access their services, ensuring immediate support for families in limbo.   

Activities: The charity runs age-stratified social clubs, including "Wild & Wacky" soft play, "Gamer’s Cage" for teens, and "Art Empower" workshops.   

Parent Support: "Parent/Carer Connect" sessions and "Walk and Talk" events provide a peer support network, reducing the isolation often felt by SEND families.   

Advocacy: Their "Signpost" service assists with the complexities of Education, Health and Care Plans (EHCPs) and benefits, leveraging the "lived experience" of their staff

services.summary: Operates across Essex to support adults with learning disabilities and autism into sustainable employment. Keywords: adults learning, job coaching, vocational profiling, ensure long, match.
services.description:
Operates across Essex to support adults with learning disabilities and autism into sustainable employment.
They utilize "vocational profiling" to match individual skills to employer needs and provide job coaching and travel training to ensure long-term retention.

services.name: Neurodiverse Boxing
services.summary: An innovative collaboration between Harlow Amateur Boxing Club and Active Essex provides free boxing lessons specifically for neurodivergent individuals. Keywords: boxing, club, therapeutic, 00, non contact.
services.description:
An innovative collaboration between Harlow Amateur Boxing Club and Active Essex provides free boxing lessons specifically for neurodivergent individuals.

Schedule: Saturdays at 11:00 am – 12:00 pm at the club on Momples Road.   

Therapeutic Value: The program uses non-contact boxing to improve fitness, focus, memory, and coordination, demonstrating the therapeutic potential of sport.

services.name: Families in Focus
services.summary: This charity provides the technical and legal scaffolding for families navigating the SEND system. Keywords: families, send, clubs, accessible harlow, guide.
services.description:
This charity provides the technical and legal scaffolding for families navigating the SEND system.

Educational Advocacy: They offer expert guidance on securing Education, Health and Care Plans (EHCPs), supporting families through the drafting process, annual reviews, and even tribunals.   

Benefit Support: They assist with the complex applications for Disability Living Allowance (DLA) and Personal Independence Payment (PIP), often hosting online clinics to guide parents through the forms.   

Social Clubs: They run "Saturday Activity Clubs" (currently in Chelmsford) that are accessible to Harlow families, providing a safe space for SEND children and their siblings.

services.name: Find Your Active
services.summary: CounActive Essex offers Harlow residents a variety of services aimed at making physical activity accessible and supportive of mental wellbeing. Keywords: activity, residents, local, services, physical activity.
services.description:
CounActive Essex offers Harlow residents a variety of services aimed at making physical activity accessible and supportive of mental wellbeing. Based on the "Find Your Active" initiative, here is a succinct overview:

**Services**

* **Mental Wellbeing Support:** The "Move For Your Mind" programme uses physical activity to help manage stress and improve mood.
* **Holiday Programmes:** "Essex ActivAte" provides holiday activity and food clubs for children and young people.
* **Activity Database:** A comprehensive "Activity Finder" tool allows residents to locate local sports clubs, sessions, and inclusive groups.
* **Financial Support:** Small grants are available for community groups and grassroots organisations to help them offer local activities.

**Delivery**

* **Digital Tools:** Residents can access services through an online search engine to find nearby opportunities.
* **Community Sessions:** Activity is delivered through local community-led sessions such as walking groups, yoga, and dance.
* **Partnerships:** Services are offered in collaboration with local health professionals, schools, and mental health charities like Mind.

**Target Audience**
While available to **all Harlow residents**, the services specifically target:

* People experiencing poor mental health or high stress.
* Children and families, particularly those eligible for free school meals (via Essex ActivAte).
* Older adults and people with disabilities or long-term health conditions.
* Residents looking for low-cost or free ways to stay active.ty-wide partnership promoting local sport, physical activity, and inclusive fitness tailored to your lifestyle

services.summary: Online hub providing instructor-led exercise videos for different fitness levels and physical conditions Keywords: instructor, instructor led, videos, videos different, hub providing.

services.summary: This NHS service represents a progressive approach to women's health. Keywords: women, empowering women, appointment empowering, uniquely offers, pelvic health.
services.description:
This NHS service represents a progressive approach to women's health. It supports those experiencing pelvic health issues (incontinence, prolapse) during pregnancy and up to 12 months postpartum.

Access: Uniquely, it offers a self-referral pathway via an online form, removing the need for a GP appointment and empowering women to seek help directly.

Services: It offers health visiting, infant feeding support, school nursing, and developmental checks.   

Delivery Sites: Services are also delivered at satellite sites like The Meadows and Potter Street to ensure neighborhood-level access.   

Activity: The hub hosts "Healthy Family Drop-ins" and specialized sessions like "Sparkles" for SEND children.

Home Visiting: Trained volunteers visit families in their own homes to provide practical and emotional support.   

Groups: They run "Family Groups" and "Fitness and Fun" sessions to encourage parent-child bonding and physical activity.   

Access: Families can self-refer via the website or telephone (01245 847410)

Opening Hours: Mon-Fri, 9:00 am – 5:00 pm (Wednesdays open at 10:00 am).

IPS-Y: A pilot program specifically targeting 14-18-year-olds in West Essex, bridging the gap between education and employment for vulnerable youth.

services.name: Essex Wellbeing Service
services.summary: The service acts as a gateway to several specialist offerings for older residents: Care Navigation: Connecting individuals with a network of specialist… Keywords: community agents, agents, support, safety, specialist.
services.description:
The service acts as a gateway to several specialist offerings for older residents:

Care Navigation: Connecting individuals with a network of specialist partners (CareNav+), including the Alzheimer’s Society, Essex Dementia Care, and Community Agents who support vulnerable adults.

Social Isolation Support: Provision of wellbeing coaches, befriending coordinators, and community agents to combat loneliness and improve social contact.

Practical Health & Safety: Facilitating ECL Sensory support (for hearing and sight loss) and Essex Fire Service home safety visits.

Healthy Lifestyle Support: Assistance with weight management, smoking cessation, alcohol reduction, and physical activity tailored to individual needs.

Carer Support: Help for those caring for elderly relatives through partnerships with organizations like Action for Family Carers.

this project provides the hardware and skills necessary for modern life.

services.name: Harlow Rainbow Services
services.summary: Rainbow Services is a cornerstone of Harlow's voluntary sector. Keywords: community, project, hub, residents, social.
services.description:
Rainbow Services is a cornerstone of Harlow's voluntary sector.

Community Hub: Located in the Harvey Centre and Wych Elm, this hub acts as a physical "front door" for crisis support, volunteering information, and signposting.   

Community Builder: This project actively supports residents in setting up their own social groups, shifting the dynamic from "service delivery" to "community empowerment".   

Social Prescribing: They manage the "My Health Matters" project, connecting residents with non-clinical support for issues like loneliness.

services.category: Age Related Needs (Mobility, Lifestyle, Care, Community)
services.name: British Red Cross
services.summary: For temporary mobility needs, the Red Cross in Harlow provides a wheelchair hire service. Keywords: hire, rapid deployment, deployment post, deployment, available unable.
services.description:
For temporary mobility needs, the Red Cross in Harlow provides a wheelchair hire service.

Cost: Standard hire is £22 per week, with a delivery/collection fee of £30.   

Access: Assistance is available for those unable to pay, and no GP referral is required, ensuring rapid deployment for post-operative recovery or end-of-life care

services.summary: Located on the River Stort, CanalAbility offers a unique accessible leisure experience. Keywords: stort, accessible, ramps accessible, disabilities actively, toilets.
services.description:
Located on the River Stort, CanalAbility offers a unique accessible leisure experience.

Infrastructure: They operate purpose-built broad beam boats ("Stort Daybreak" and "Stort Challenger") equipped with lifts, ramps, and accessible toilets.   

Inclusivity: The design allows wheelchair users and those with complex disabilities to actively participate in steering the boat and operating locks, promoting agency and independence.

services.description:
Focusing on mental health, Employ-Ability uses the Individual Placement and Support (IPS) model.

Job Retention: They offer a specific service for those struggling to maintain employment due to mental ill health, negotiating "reasonable adjustments" with employers.   

IPS-Y: A pilot program specifically targeting 14-18-year-olds in West Essex, bridging the gap between education and employment for vulnerable youth.

services.name: Harlow Men’s Shed
services.summary: Situated in the Walled Garden of Harlow Town Park, this initiative addresses male isolation through shared practical tasks. Keywords: shoulder, men, face, 00, tasks schedule.
services.description:
Situated in the Walled Garden of Harlow Town Park, this initiative addresses male isolation through shared practical tasks.

Schedule: Open every Tuesday (10:00 am – 4:00 pm).   

Concept: Men work on woodwork and repair projects "shoulder to shoulder," a dynamic proven to facilitate conversation and mental well-being more effectively than face-to-face therapy for many men.
